Omiscid::AccumulatorConnectorListener Class Reference
[Examples of how to use OMiSCID.]

this class is used to monitor incomming activity from intput connector of a service More...

Detailed Description

this class is used to monitor incomming activity from intput connector of a service

Definition at line 29 of file Accumulator.cpp.

Member Function Documentation

void AccumulatorConnectorListener::MessageReceived ( Service &  TheService,
const SimpleString  LocalConnectorName,
const Message &  Msg 
) [virtual]

Processes a received Omiscid message. As a given message could be processed by several others listeners, the message must not be modified by its processing.

Parameters:
TheService the service which received the message
LocalConnectorName the name of the connector that has received the message
Msg the message to process

Reimplemented from Omiscid::ConnectorListener.

00063 {
00064     // Error management
00065     bool IsWrong = true;    // by default, the command is wrong
00066     SimpleString ErrorMessage = "Bad command.";
00067
00068     // Used to read operand ?
00069     float fRightOperand = 0.0f;
00070
00071     // A pointer to the command line and to the begining of the usufull data
00072     char * Command;
00073     int  StartUsefullInfo;
00074
00075     // parse string to understand command
00076     // Start lock myself using my mutex (needed if multiple clients)
00077     Locker.EnterMutex();
00078
00079     // Get the pointer to the data
00080     Command = Msg.GetBuffer();
00081
00082     // skip data while there are spaces...
00083     for( StartUsefullInfo = 0; Command[StartUsefullInfo] != '\0'; StartUsefullInfo++ )
00084     {
00085         if ( Command[StartUsefullInfo] != ' ' &&  Command[StartUsefullInfo] != '\t' &&
00086              Command[StartUsefullInfo] != '\r' && Command[StartUsefullInfo] != '\n' )
00087         {
00088             break;
00089         }
00090     }
00091
00092     // Is it a legal command ?
00093     if ( Command[StartUsefullInfo] == '-' || Command[StartUsefullInfo] == '+' ||
00094             Command[StartUsefullInfo] == '/' || Command[StartUsefullInfo] == '*' ||
00095             Command[StartUsefullInfo] == '=' )
00096     {
00097         // look for a float like 3.14 and then for
00098         if ( sscanf( &Command[StartUsefullInfo+1], "%f", &fRightOperand ) == 1 )
00099         {
00100             IsWrong = false;
00101         }
00102         // else IsWrong == true;
00103
00104         // If it is ok,
00105         if ( IsWrong == false )
00106         {
00107             // run the command
00108             switch( Command[StartUsefullInfo] )
00109             {
00110                 case '-':
00111                     // Compute new value
00112                     Accu -= fRightOperand;
00113                     break;
00114
00115                 case '+':
00116                     // Compute new value
00117                     Accu += fRightOperand;
00118                     break;
00119
00120                 case '*':
00121                     // Compute new value
00122                     Accu *= fRightOperand;
00123                     break;
00124
00125                 case '/':
00126                     if ( fRightOperand == 0.0f )
00127                     {
00128                         // we can not divide by 0
00129                         IsWrong = true;
00130                     }
00131                     else
00132                     {
00133                         // Compute new value
00134                         Accu /= fRightOperand;
00135                     }
00136                     break;
00137
00138                 default:     // here, Command[0] == '='
00139                     Accu = fRightOperand;
00140                     break;
00141             }
00142         }
00143     }
00144     if ( IsWrong == false )
00145     {
00146         // export the new Accu value, so the clients will receive notification
00147         TheService.SetVariableValue("Accu", Accu);
00148     }
00149     else
00150     {
00151         // Discard value and send back to the rigth "person" an error message in safe mode (TCP/SHM - when implemented)
00152         TheService.SendToOneClient( LocalConnectorName, (char*)ErrorMessage.GetStr(), ErrorMessage.GetLength(), Msg.GetPeerId(), false );
00153     }
00154
00155     // Unlock myself
00156     Locker.LeaveMutex();
00157 }
